conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and properties of gas at states A and B.
Diagram shows pressure-volume relationship for the gas.
At state A, pressure is 3 × 10⁵ Pa and volume is 1 × 10⁻³ m³. At state B, pressure is 1 × 10⁵ Pa and volume is 2 × 10⁻³ m³.
Use ideal gas law PV = nRT.
Calculate number of moles using initial and final states.
Substitute known values into equation for n_A and n_B.
Number of moles are equal, temperature at state B is same as state A.
Calculate temperature at state B using n_B and R.
Final answer: Temperature of gas at state B is 32.3°C.
